sentence.Network_en: I dosed him up with Valium.
She dosed up the children with cough syrup.
sentence.Network_cn: 她把止咳糖浆给孩子们喝了.

list.abs: ...exposure dose, 当量剂量当量剂量,equivalent dose, 把乘上了适当的修正系数后的吸收剂量,absorbed dose,称为当量剂量,equivalent dose,用符号H表示,当量剂量只限于防护中应用,组织中某点处.
accumulated depreciation 累计折旧accumulated dose 累积剂量accumulated error 累积误差
dose 剂量dose equivalent 剂量当量dose rate 放射量率

entry.def: A dose of medicine or a drug is a measured amount of it which is intended to be taken at one time.

example.ex: One dose of penicillin can wipe out the infection.
example.tran: 一剂青霉素就能消除感染。

entry.tran: (尤指数量很多的)一份，一次，一点
entry.def: You can refer to an amount of something as a dose of that thing, especially when you want to emphasize that there is a great deal of it.

example.ex: She was born with a healthy dose of self-confidence...
The West is getting a heavy dose of snow and rain today.
example.tran: 西部今天将迎来一场大的雨夹雪。

entry.def: If you dose a person or animal with medicine, you give them an amount of it.

example.ex: The doctor fixed the rib, dosed him heavily with drugs, and said he would probably get better...
example.tran: 医生接好了肋骨，给他服用了大剂量的药，并说他可能会有所好转。

means.word_mean: 1. treated with some kind of application;
